Class AssignmentHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • AssignmentHelper

  • public class AssignmentHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    AssignmentHelper is a utility class which contains methods to assist you with input and output.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • displayApplicationHeading

        public static void displayApplicationHeading(java.lang.String title,
                                             java.lang.String subTitle)
        Outputs the application title and sub title with an underline to the screen. The underline length will equal the length of the title or sub title depending which is larger.

        Example:

        Red River College
        Student Registration System
        ===========================

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the application.
        subTitle - The sub-title of the application.

      • displayApplicationHeading

        public static void displayApplicationHeading(java.lang.String title,
                                             java.lang.String subTitle,
                                             char character)
        Outputs the application title and sub title with an underline to the screen using a specified character.

        The underline length will equal the length of the title or sub title depending which is larger.

        Sample using asterisk:

        Red River College

        Student Registration System
        ***************************

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the application.
        subTitle - The sub-title of the application.
        character - The character to use as the underline.

      • displaySectionTitle

        public static void displaySectionTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Outputs the title and underline for a section of output. The underline length will match the length of the title.

        Example:

        Student Summary
        ---------------

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the application.

      • getPositiveIntegerInput

        public static int getPositiveIntegerInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                          java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Returns an positive integer input value from the keyboard.

        The method displays a custom prompt and error message.

        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt text displayed to the user.
        errorMessage - The message text displayed when there is an input error.
        Returns:
        The positive integer value entered from the keyboard.

      • getStringInput

        public static java.lang.String getStringInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                              java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Returns a String input value from the keyboard.

        The method displays a custom prompt and error message.

        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt text displayed to the user.
        errorMessage - The message text displayed when there is an input error.
        Returns:
        The String value entered from the keyboard.

      • getRangeInput

        public static int getRangeInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                int startRange,
                                int endRange)
        Returns an integer input, where the input must be within the defined range. A start range value less than or equal to zero will result in the start range being the value 1. An end range value less than or equal to the start range, will result in the end range being start range plus 1.

        The method displays a custom prompt and error message.

        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt text displayed to the user.
        errorMessage - The message text displayed when there is an input error.
        startRange - The lowest value in the range.
        endRange - The largest value in the range.
        Returns:
        The input value from the keyboard.

      • getPositiveDoubleInput

        public static double getPositiveDoubleInput(java.lang.String prompt,
                                            java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                            boolean isZeroAllowed)
        Returns a positive double input value from the keyboard.

        The method displays a custom prompt and error message.

        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt text displayed to the user.
        errorMessage - The message text displayed when there is an input error.
        isZeroAllowed - True does not include a zero value in the input validation; False a zero value is included in the input validation.
        Returns:
        The positive double input value entered from the keyboard.

      • getYesOrNoResponse

        public static boolean getYesOrNoResponse(java.lang.String prompt,
                                         java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Returns a response to a yes or no question.

        The method displays a custom prompt and error message.

        It is recommended that your prompt include the options 'y' or 'n'.

        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt text displayed to the user.
        errorMessage - The message text displayed when there is an input error.
        Returns:
        True when input is "y"; False when input is "n";
